content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: SESEQ
      operator: target_is_sorted_by
      value:
        - SESTDTC
        - USUBJID
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SENDIG.130
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Trigger error when the order of SESEQ is not chronologically (based on
  SESTDTC) within USUBJID
Outcome:
  Message: SESEQ is not chronologically (based on SESTDTC) within USUBJID
  Output Variables:
    - USUBJID
#    - SESEQ
    - SESTDTC

Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SENDIG
        Version: '3.1'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '130'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: The values of SESTDTC provide the chronological order
                  of the actual subject Elements.  SESEQ should be assigned to be
                  consistent with the chronological order.
                Document: IG v3.1
                Item: Specification
                Section: 5.3.1.1
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - SPECIAL-PURPOSE
  Domains:
    Include:
      - SE

json.Description: Trigger error when the order of SESEQ is not chronologically (based on SESTDTC) within USUBJID

Outcome.Message: SESEQ is not chronologically (based on SESTDTC) within USUBJID

Citations.Cited_Guidance: The values of SESTDTC provide the chronological order of the actual subject Elements.  SESEQ should be assigned to be consistent with the chronological order.
